gw.api.database.upgrade

Class DropColumnIfSafeVersionCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.database.upgrade.VersionAction
      • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.BeforeUpgradeVersionAction
        • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.BeforeUpgradeVersionCheck
          • gw.api.database.upgrade.DropColumnIfSafeVersionCheck

  • public class DropColumnIfSafeVersionCheck
extends BeforeUpgradeVersionCheck
    Checks that the given column on the given table is safe to drop, i.e.: - it is not defined in the datamodel, and - it only contains the default value given If the column is defined in the datamodel, the column is not dropped. If the column is not defined in the datamodel and has only default values, the column is dropped. If the column is not defined in the datamodel and has non-default values, a version check error is thrown.

      • canDrop

        public boolean canDrop()

      • verifyUpgradability

        public void verifyUpgradability()
        Description copied from class: BeforeUpgradeVersionCheck
        Verify that it is safe to proceed with the upgrade. For example, if we are converting text to varchar during the upgrade, then we want to verify that no values are too long before we do any of the upgrade steps.

        Implementor will add an error message for each problem detected to the UpgraderContext via a call to addVersionCheckProblem(String)

        Specified by:
        verifyUpgradability in class BeforeUpgradeVersionCheck
